properties.prefix:
Dataset


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the dataset being described. This is the primary way of naming this dataset in the system.
properties.title: Primary Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the dataset in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of alternate title such as Abbreviation.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the dataset.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the dataset and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the dataset in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the dataset for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: A standard identifier for the dataset, e.g. Dataset ID or a URI.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: This is the statement of different kinds of rights that are asserted for the dataset. This can include such things as access rights, credit lines, etc.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: The type of rights being described such as Access or Use Rights.
properties.title: Rights Type

properties.description: A description of the rights surrounding the dataset.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: A reference to another entity from which the dataset is/was derived.
properties.title: Source

properties.description: The type of source such as another Dataset.
properties.title: Source Type

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the dataset, such as the name of a larger dataset of which the dataset being described was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: The type of related item such as a project, publication or website.
properties.title: Related Item Type

properties.description: The unique identifier for the related item.
properties.title: Related Item ID

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the dataset, such as acquisition notes, historical notes, etc., and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as Field Notes, General Notes, etc.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the dataset, such as the year it was created, accessioned or significantly altered.
properties.title: Time Period

properties.description: The type of date being described such as Date Collected, Date Analyzed, etc.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the time period being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Current or historical spatial location information about the dataset being described, such as place that is the subject of the dataset, place from which it was collected or current storage place.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as the collection place or storage location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the dataset.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of date related to the place.
properties.title: Place Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations which have a special relationship to the dataset. For example, the person who created it, or an organization which funded its creation.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The type of contact being described such as Office.
properties.title: Contact Type

properties.description: The type of phone being described such as Office, Cell or Other
properties.title: Phone Type

properties.description: The type of email being described such as Office or personal.
properties.title: Email Type

properties.description: The role of a person associated with the dataset.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: A unique identifier for a person such as an ORCID ID. This should not be used for sensitive information.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: The role of the organization related to the dataset, such as “funder” or “owner”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: The Taxonomic Classification of the species referenced in the dataset (if applicable).
properties.title: Taxonomic Classification

properties.description: The name of the genus.
properties.title: Genus Name

properties.description: The name of the species.
properties.title: Species Name

properties.description: The name of the author and year of publication of a particular scientific name, e.g., Linnaeus, 1758.
properties.title: Scientific Name Authorship

properties.description: The format or media type of the dataset.
properties.title: Format

properties.description: Describe any relevant methods used to collect or enhance the dataset.
properties.title: Methods

properties.description: The type of method being described.
properties.title: Method Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the method used.
properties.title: Method

properties.description: Describe any relevant techniques used to collect or enhance the dataset.
properties.title: Techniques

properties.description: The type of techniques used to collect the dataset.
properties.title: Technique Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the technique.
properties.title: Technique

properties.description: Numeric description of the dataset such as number of objects or size of the dataset.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, “L 12 inches; H 6 inches”.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: The type of measurement such as depth, circumference, length, width or height.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: Unit of measurement such as feet, inches, centimeters, etc.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: The type of date being described such as Date Collected, Date Modified, etc.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the entity being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy
